poem:
### Parentage Observed

In the whisper of jungles veiled,  
emerald silences yield flickers  
of life tightly embraced; a mother's  
breath woven in fur settles quietly  
on young eyes. Yet, turn, and claws  
clutch at dawn's raw offering—  
a lesson written in blood, taught  
with tenderness, that to nurture  
is to tear the world open.
